subject: Climate & Environment
title: Vehicle-to-Grid Technology
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Vehicle-to-Grid Technology.

hook.text: The average car sits parked 95% of the time. What if it helped power the grid while waiting?

buildup.text: Electric vehicles carry large batteries â€” a fleet of EVs holds more energy than many power plants.

discovery.text: Vehicle-to-grid lets EVs send stored electricity back to the grid during peak demand.

twist.text: Owners get paid for the energy their parked car provides. The car earns money while you sleep.

climax.text: A million connected EVs could replace an entire natural gas peaker plant.

punchline.text: Your parked car could be the power plant of the future.

quiz.question: What does vehicle-to-grid technology allow?
options: EVs to send stored energy back to the grid
